SENT.plain: We report a case of acute massive pulmonary thromboembolism, which occurred during the second trimester of pregnancy in a 35-year-old woman with thrombocytopenia and anemia secondary to myelodysplastic syndrome
We performed successful emergency pulmonary embolectomy, under cardiopulmonary bypass, using argatroban as an anticoagulant
An intra-aortic balloon pump was used to maintain placental blood flow
The patient recovered completely and was later delivered of a healthy baby
Thus, pulmonary embolectomy saved both the mother and the fetus
